books.title: Clean Code
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.overview: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship that explains how to write clean, readable, and maintainable code.

books.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
books.author: Andrew Hunt
books.overview: A classic book covering best practices, tips, and philosophies for effective software development.

books.title: You Don't Know JS
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.overview: An in-depth series explaining JavaScript concepts such as scope, closures, and async programming.

books.title: Design Patterns
books.author: Erich Gamma et al.
books.overview: Introduces reusable object-oriented software design patterns used in real-world applications.

books.title: Refactoring
books.author: Martin Fowler
books.overview: Explains techniques to improve existing code structure without changing its external behavior.

books.title: Introduction to Algorithms
books.author: Thomas H. Cormen
books.overview: Commonly known as CLRS, this book provides a comprehensive introduction to algorithms and data structures.

books.title: Eloquent JavaScript
books.author: Marijn Haverbeke
books.overview: A modern introduction to JavaScript programming with practical examples and exercises.

books.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
books.author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
books.overview: A popular interview preparation book covering data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving techniques.

books.title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
books.author: Douglas Crockford
books.overview: Highlights the elegant and powerful features of JavaScript while avoiding its problematic parts.

books.title: Head First Design Patterns
books.author: Eric Freeman & Elisabeth Robson
books.overview: A visually rich and beginner-friendly guide to understanding and applying design patterns.
